revision.comment: Notification of altered sources needing review #IABot
revision.text: {{DYK talk|5 January|2009|entry=... that a [[messenger pigeon]] named '''[[Commando (pigeon)|Commando]]''' received the [[Dickin Medal]] in 1945 for carrying crucial intelligence from agents in [[occupied France]] to [[Great Britain|Britain]] during [[World War II]]?|views=2194}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Military history|class=B |B1=yes|B2=yes|B3=yes|B4=yes|B5=yes |British=yes |WWII=yes }} {{WikiProject Birds|class=start|importance=low|needs-photo=yes}} {{WikiProject Sussex|importance=low|class=C}} }} == B class rating? == I don't think this article is quite up to a B rating just yet. Problems I see are the red links and the lack of an image (nothing to add visual interest).--[[User:Sting au|Sting]] ''[[User_talk:Sting au|Buzz Me...]]'' 00:40, 2 January 2009 (UTC) == two ways? == OK, I'm an ignoramus, but I always thought that homing pigeons could only be relied on to go home, and had to be taken out to their starting point. How did this one successfully navigate back and forth between Britain and France? Some sort of explanation should be included, I think. --[[User:Piledhigheranddeeper|Piledhigheranddeeper]] ([[User talk:Piledhigheranddeeper|talk]]) 00:20, 5 January 2009 (UTC) :No you are not an ignoramus. When the article states "more than ninety trips into and out of German occupied France," he was carried into France by a parachuting soldier. Then later released with an attached message to fly home with. The article does not mention that, so I'll see what I can do.--[[User:Sting au|Sting]] ''[[User_talk:Sting au|Buzz Me...]]'' 00:30, 5 January 2009 (UTC) ::I'm just looking through ''The Pigeon'' by Wendell Levi at the moment. There is a great picture of a British Paratrooper carrying a cylindrical container (with air holes in end) for holding the [[Carrier pigeon|messenger]] pigeons. I can't use it because of copyright but it illustrates the method well. The section also mentions that the [[National Pigeon Service]] was a volunteer civilian organisation formed in 1938.--[[User:Sting au|Sting]] ''[[User_talk:Sting au|Buzz Me...]]'' 00:38, 5 January 2009 (UTC) ==Death== When did he die? Or, is he still alive by any chance? [[User:Stonemason89|Stonemason89]] ([[User talk:Stonemason89|talk]]) 22:45, 6 October 2010 (UTC) ==County notability== I've added a project banner per [[Talk:All_Alone_(pigeon)]] in which I have no interests, the relevant banner had been added by someone else. Please write '''there''' whether you support or object to a county category added to the elite war pigeons who received the [[Dickin Medal]] in principle. - [[User:Adam37|'''Adam37''']] [[User talk:Adam37|Talk]] 18:11, 22 October 2013 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just added archive links to {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[Commando (pigeon)]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=701749955 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20080922204813/http://www.pdsa.org.uk:80/page309_3.html to http://www.pdsa.org.uk/page309_3.html When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' to let others know. {{sourcecheck|checked=false}} Cheers.â€”[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]][[User talk:Cyberbot II|Talk to my owner]]:Online 10:33, 26 January 2016 (UTC)
